p: Concerning Ocular Herpes Simplex (VHS), the risk of appearance and relapse increases, not so much because of the number of hours of outdoor activities, which could be a protection factor with a UV index < 4, but when these activities are carried out with a UV index > 4. Thus, a UV index > 4 increases the risk of a VHS outbreak by 33% [ 7]. In Southern Spain, the UV index > 4 is usually present from April to October [ 86]. The VHS incidence in Spain from 2000 to 2008 grew by 40% [ 104, 105]. A global cost between 2033 and 2366 euros/outbreak/patient has been estimated, including costs for the medical procedure, sick leave, treatment and use of facilities. Between 2011 and 2017 116,000 cases/year were recorded, with a trend towards increase, only interrupted in 2017 [ 106].
